actions.text: Amendment SA 69 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

Amendment SA 69 proposed by Senator Stevens for Senator Clinton. (consideration: CR S1412; text: CR S1412) To authorize the use of certain previously appropriated funds by the Federal Emergency Management Agency to be used for health examinations of emergency services personnel who responded to the terrorist attacks on the United States on September 11, 2001.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 69 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 69 proposed by Senator Stevens for Senator Clinton.

purpose: To authorize the use of certain previously appropriated funds by the Federal Emergency Management Agency to be used for health examinations of emergency services personnel who responded to the terrorist attacks on the United States on September 11, 2001.
